London celebrated her 11th birthday in 2024, while Eric is pursuing his passion for basketball as a student-athlete at the University of Maine Augusta.

Aaron Jamal Crawford is an American retired professional basketball player known for his tenure in the NBA from 2000 to 2020.

Recognized as one of the premier sixth men and ball handlers in NBA history, Crawfordâs career spanned multiple teams, including the Cleveland Cavaliers, Chicago Bulls, New York Knicks, and more.

His accomplishments include being the only three-time NBA Sixth Man of the Year, setting records for scoring 50 points with four different teams, and leading in four-point plays in NBA history.

Additionally, Crawford ranks 10th in career three-point field goal attempts and is the second player in NBA history to surpass 10,000 career points as a reserve.

Following retirement, Crawford transitioned into providing commentary on NBA League Pass starting in 2021.

Who are Eric And London Crawford?

On August 26, 2014, Jamal Crawford, the renowned retired NBA player, exchanged vows with his longtime girlfriend, Tori Lucas.

The union blossomed into a beautiful family with the arrival of seven children.

Among them are Eric and London, who share the spotlight as the offspring of the esteemed basketball star alongside their five other siblings: Chase, JJ, Aaliyah, Tamia, and Aerin.

Eric, the eldest of the siblings, is carving his path in basketball at the University of Maine Augusta, where he is pursuing a degree in Business Administration.

Similarly, JJ, born on June 6, 2010, and London, who celebrated her eleventh birthday in 2024, add youthful energy to the family dynamic.

Aerin entered the world on June 10, 2016, bringing joy and laughter into the Crawford household.

While details about Aaliyah, Tamia, and Chase remain undisclosed, the Crawford family continues to thrive, cherishing moments of love, growth, and togetherness.

As Eric keeps his birthdate private, the exact age gap between him and his father remains a mystery, adding an element of intrigue to their familial bond.

Uncertain of Crawfordâs reaction, Coleman said he would start on the bench.

Drawing inspiration from his father, NBA Sixth Man of the Year Jamal Crawford, Eric reflected on how his fatherâs role influenced his familyâs life.

Despite coming from a family with a basketball legacy, Eric unexpectedly transferred from multiple small colleges before ultimately reaching UMaine-Augusta for his third year of college basketball.

While his father pursues an NBA contract, Ericâs experience in Maine has fostered growth, influenced by his grandfatherâs basketball guidance.

Adapting to Maineâs lifestyle, Eric embraced the opportunity to focus on basketball and academics, thriving despite initial challenges.

Eric and his friend Cordale Addison actively participate in a developing business endeavor, Laylow Sports Agency, which aims to represent basketball players and establish a Black-owned sports agency alongside his college basketball career.

Planning to continue his college basketball journey, Eric envisions celebrating achievements with his family, including his father, at the Augusta Civic Center.
